name: Acute Mesenteric Ischemia
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain that came on suddenly
prognosis: Poor if not treated within first few hours; mortality remains high (60-80%) even with treatment due to bowel necrosis
description: Sudden loss of blood flow to the small intestine, typically due to arterial embolism, thrombosis, or venous occlusion. Leads to bowel ischemia and potential necrosis if not treated emergently. Often presents with pain out of proportion to exam findings.
